H0.text: By causing surface water to evaporate, the Sun helps move water from the ocean through the water cycle.

H1.text: By adding particles to the water, the Sun helps move water from the ocean through the water cycle.

H2.text: By increasing the amount of water, the Sun helps move water from the ocean through the water cycle.

H3.text: Blowing water toward land is how the Sun helps move water from the ocean through the water cycle.

A4.text: the energy from the sun heats the water in oceans, lakes, streams, rivers, seas, ponds, etc.

A5.text: Evaporation often implicitly includes transpiration from plants, though together they are specifically referred to as evapotranspiration.
